body_html:
Unfortunately, the TensorFlow maintainers do not have the bandwidth to provide support for building from source using cross-compilers and rely on community support for that.

That said, one thing that does come to mind from your description:
The linking error might be because you're not including libtensorflow_framework.so, which libtensorflow_cc.so depends on. However, you could build a single library that doesn't have this dependency by adding --config=monolithic to the bazel commandline, so:

bazel build -c opt \
  --config=monolithic \
  //tensorflow:libtensorflow_cc.so \
  --crosstool_top=//external:android/crosstool \
  --host_crosstool_top=@bazel_tools//tools/cpp:toolchain \
  --cpu=arm64-v8a

@andrewharp may have some more insights.

body:
Unfortunately, the TensorFlow maintainers do not have the bandwidth to provide support for building from source using cross-compilers and rely on community support for that.

That said, one thing that does come to mind from your description:
The linking error might be because you're not including `libtensorflow_framework.so`, which `libtensorflow_cc.so` depends on. However, you could build a single library that doesn't have this dependency by adding `--config=monolithic` to the `bazel` commandline, so:

```sh
bazel build -c opt \
  --config=monolithic \
  //tensorflow:libtensorflow_cc.so \
  --crosstool_top=//external:android/crosstool \
  --host_crosstool_top=@bazel_tools//tools/cpp:toolchain \
  --cpu=arm64-v8a
```

@andrewharp may have some more insights.
